session_items.Title: Welcome to Rocket.Chat GSOC Demo Day 2022!
session_items.Description: Let's welcome all participants, contributors and Mentor!
session_items.Speaker: Gabriel Engel & Rodrigo Nascimento

session_items.Title: Standalone Desktop Messaging cross-platforms Applet
session_items.Description: Create a simpler desktop application where there is a simple channels list on a little window and each chat will open in another separated window, making it possible to talk with people without opening a big window. Making the usage of Rocket.chat more seamless.
session_items.Speaker: Ahmed Ibrahim
Danish Ahmed Mirza
session_items.Title: New Emoji Picker for Mobile Client
session_items.Description: Action sheets are a very common UX pattern which are used to interact with quick actions and can be found in almost every mobile app nowadays. There are already multiple places where Bottom Action Sheets are used in Rocket.Chat app like the message actions menu. The main goal of the project is to redesign and add more features to the existing Emoji Picker, Reactions List and the other components, improving the overall user experience and then render them as Bottom Action Sheet.

session_items.Speaker: Devanshu
session_items.Title: Rocket.Chat for Virtual Conferences
session_items.Description: An open source scaled virtual conferences creation, management, and operation system. It aims to enable online communities to easily run and host virtual events of any size. The system is designed to be flexibily customizable and fully scalable from day one, extending contemporary ReactJS components with full stack behaviors, powered by NextJS. This project leverages FOSS Asia's excellent open source Event-yay server backend for conference creation and management. For day of conference operations, this project leverage open source Jitsi video's broadcast capability to an RTMP-forest for scaled consumption while embedded  Rocket.Chat enables attendees and speakers to mingle and collaborate freely – with full persistent chat history.

session_items.Speaker: Irfan Asif
session_items.Title: Rocket.Chat Figma App
session_items.Mentor: Douglas Gubert, Ivan Netto & Alvaro Mello
session_items.Description: This project will help designers to connect with Figma directly from Rocket.Chat. Design teams will be able to receive notifications from Figma in their channels and manage their designs systems in an efficient way.

session_items.Speaker: Mustafa Hasan Khan
session_items.Title: ClickUp App for Rocket.Chat
session_items.Description: ClickUp is the #1 task/project management platform, even used by the Rocket.Chat team and many other teams that collaborate on Rocket.Chat

session_items.Speaker: Nishant Patel
session_items.Title: Message Forwarding (For Rocket.Chat)
session_items.Description: This project implements the ability to forward messages to another channel, thread, or discussion. It significantly improves the user's experience and their productivity.

session_items.Speaker: Samad Khan
session_items.Title: Rocket.Chat GitHub App
session_items.Description: The GitHub App is a GitHub Integration for Rocket.Chat which will enable developers to perform GitHub actions right from Rocket.Chat channels. It enable users to fetch repository data, subscribe to repository events, open new issues, search GitHub for issues and pull requests, review and merge pull request and do much more right from Rocket.Chat. The GitHub App seamlessly integrates GitHub functionalities with Rocket.Chat and improves the collaboration between developers.

session_items.Speaker: Sangyul Cha
session_items.Title: Botpress Connector Enhancements
session_items.Description: This project extends a existing community-contributed Botpress connector to facilitate deployment of Botpress chatbots and Omnichannel bots. Better rich UI/UX / interaction support for bots and ability to run multiple instances of multiple bots.

session_items.Speaker: Sidharth Mohanty
session_items.Title: Embedded Chat Component
session_items.Description: EmbeddedChat allows users to integrate RocketChat into their React web-based applications easily also providing an amazing developer experience while introducing in-app chat solutions.

session_items.Speaker: Sitaram Rathi
session_items.Title: Rocket.Chat Terminal User Interface
session_items.Description: Rocket Chat right now is present as a web, app and desktop client. I've expanded rocket chat to a fourth platform right into the terminal of user by developing it's Terminal User Interface. It has all the basic functionalities of login using email and access token, sending and receiving messages in realtime, lisitng and navigating in channels and DMs, slash commands, @ mentioning still adding more in it.

session_items.Speaker: Vivek Srivastava
session_items.Title: Playground for UIKit ReactJS components
session_items.Description: Playground is an application that lets developers test different components and aspects of a Fuselage UI kit without having to set up a server and go through all the motions to test it. It will also allow developers to generate code used by Rocket.Chat apps and edit the content to preview the result.

session_items.Speaker: Yuqing
session_items.Title: Rocket.Chat - Teams Bridge: interop with Microsoft Teams
session_items.Mentor: Gabriel Engel, Yash Rajpal & Fábio Albuquerque
session_items.Description: TeamsBridge is a Rocket.Chat App to support cross-platform collaboration between Rocket.Chat and Microsoft Teams.

session_items.Title: Welcome to Rocket.Chat GSOC Alumni Summit 2023!
session_items.Description: Let's welcome all participants, contributors and Mentor!
session_items.Speaker: Gabriel Engel & Sing Li & Rodrigo Nascimento

session_items.Title: Tips for creating a winning proposal!
session_items.Description: Ever wondered what's so special in an accepted proposal? Want to know what mentors look for in your proposal? Join in this fun conversation by a past GSoCer and a current GSoC mentor of two projects to know all you can do to make your proposal shine among others.
session_items.Speaker: Murtaza Patrawala

session_items.Title: Opensource to Opportunities
session_items.Description: A talk that aims to explore how open source projects can provide opportunities for personal growth and professional development. The talk will highlight how contributing to open source projects can help participants build a portfolio of work, network with like-minded individuals, and develop technical skills. Attendees will learn about the different ways they can get involved in open source projects, and how doing so can lead to exciting opportunities in the tech industry. This talk is perfect for anyone interested in exploring the world of open source and discovering how it can help them advance their career goals.
session_items.Speaker: Sidharth Mohanty

session_items.Title: Mentor expectation and mentee approach
session_items.Description: This talk covers the expectations mentors have from their mentees and how mentees can approach their mentors effectively to get the most out of their mentorship experience.
session_items.Speaker: Mustafa Hasan Khan

session_items.Title: Break - Networking
session_items.Description: Time to chat with other participants and mentors
session_items.Speaker: Community

session_items.Title: Building a Rocket Chat App
session_items.Description: This talk will provide practical tips and advice for contributors interested in learning more about building RC Apps
session_items.Speaker: Samad Khan

session_items.Title: Best practices for writing code/project documentation
session_items.Description: Writing clear and concise documentation is a key part of developing a successful project. This talk will cover best practices for writing effective code and project documentation, including tips for organizing and structuring documentation, using the appropriate tone and language, and providing examples and illustrations to help users understand the project. Additionally, we will discuss how documentation can help attract new contributors to the project and foster a culture of collaboration and transparency. Whether you are a seasoned developer or new to open source, this talk will provide valuable insights into how to create high-quality documentation that helps users understand and engage with your project
session_items.Speaker: Fongang Rodrique

session_items.Title: Ways to give back to the open-source community and mentor future GSoC participants
session_items.Description: This talk will focus on different ways in which individuals can give back to the open-source community and support future participants of programs like Google Summer of Code (GSoC). The talk may cover topics such as contributing to open-source projects, organizing events and workshops to help new contributors, and becoming a mentor for GSoC or similar programs. The aim of this talk is to encourage attendees to actively contribute to the open-source community and help others get started with their own contributions.
session_items.Speaker: Devanshu Sharma

session_items.Title: Practical approach to ace your GSoC safari with ease
session_items.Description: This talk will provide practical tips and advice for students who are participating in Google Summer of Code (GSoC), an annual program that offers stipends to university students to work on open source software projects. Attendees will learn about strategies for finding and selecting a project, communicating with mentors, writing strong project proposals, and successfully completing the program.
session_items.Speaker: Dhruv Jain

session_items.Title: Q&A
session_items.Description: Questions time, bring any questions you might have :)
session_items.Speaker: Community

session_items.Title: Final Notes
session_items.Description: Let's wrap up the summit!
session_items.Speaker: Community
